articles.content: CDC Director Rochelle Walensky said in an interview with NPR on Wednesday that the nation is fighting headwinds in the fight to end the pandemic from new variants of the virus and efforts to rollback… [+5546 chars]
articles.description: With new cases teetering at about 60,000 to 70,000 per day, new hyper-transmissible variants and state rollbacks of coronavirus restrictions, the CDC chief urges Americans to remain vigilant.
articles.title: 'Now Is Not The Time To Stop Wearing A Mask,' Says CDC Director Rochelle Walensky - NPR
